newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Health Water sees '97 net surge on sales.
newsitem.headline: Health Water sees '97 net surge on sales.

text.p: Strong mineral water sales are expected to push up 1997 profits for Shenzhen Health Mineral Water Co Ltd's, a company spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Shenzhen Health has set a 45 million yuan net profit target for 1997 and aims for turnover of 280 million yuan based on international accounting standards, she told the Hong Kong-based China Securities Bulletin newsletter.
The mineral water producer booked net profit of 33.97 million yuan in 1996 against 22.57 million in 1995 based on international accounting standards.

Shenzhen Health's turnover reached 151.69 million yuan compared with 161.2 million in 1995 under Chinese standards according to the 1996 annual report, published in the Shenzhen-based Securities Times.
The 1996 profit rose despite a drop in turnover because PVC bottle prices were half that of 1995, the spokeswoman said.

Earnings per share of Shenzhen Health, which has both A and B shares listed in Shenzhen, rose to 0.25 yuan in 1996 against 0.18 yuan in 1995, based on domestic accounting standards, the annual report said.
Net assets per share dipped to 2.23 yuan last year compared with 2.59 yuan in 1995.
Shenzhen Health's board of directors proposed a cash dividend of 0.118 yuan per share based on 1996 profit, pending approval of shareholders at a meeting on May 9, the report said.
